data.name: AssociateFile
data.value: Link a file with an episode

data.name: MSG_ERR_FileNotFound
data.value: The file could not be found

data.name: MSG_ERR_AnimeIDRequired
data.value: Please enter a valid AniDB Anime ID

data.value: The Episode range you have entered is not valid.

data.name: Tooltip_DeleteLink
data.value: Remove link between this file and the episode.

data.name: Info_SettingsEssential
data.value: The essentials panel contains all settings that are required to run Shoko. For the Shoko Server and AniDB Login sections, you'll need to click the "Test And Save" button to save any changes you make.

data.name: Tooltip_GroupSearch
data.value: Search groups by name (in any language), category or tag

data.name: Tooltip_AniDBDownloadChar
data.value: Download information and images about the characters and seiyuu that appear in anime

data.name: Tooltip_AniDBDownloadRelated
data.value: When downloading information about an anime, also download information about all the related anime. This is needed to properly group related anime during the import process.

data.name: Tooltip_AniDBDownloadReleaseGroups
data.value: Download detailed information about the release/subbing groups for your anime

data.name: Tooltip_AniDBDownloadReviews
data.value: Downloaded anime reviews by AniDB users

data.name: Tooltip_AniDBDownloadSimilar
data.value: When downloading information about an anime, also download information about similar and recommended titles

data.name: Tooltip_AniDBMyListAddFiles
data.value: If selected when importing files, the files will be added to your AniDB account

data.name: Tooltip_AniDBMyListReadUnwatched
data.value: If the file is set as un-watched on AniDB, it will also be set as un-watched on your local collection

data.name: Tooltip_AniDBMyListReadWatched
data.value: If the file is set as watched on AniDB, it will also be set as watched on your local collection

data.name: Tooltip_AniDBMyListSetUnwatched
data.value: When you manually mark a video as watched, AniDB will also be updated

data.name: Tooltip_AniDBMyListSetWatched
data.value: When you finish watching a video, or manually mark a video as watched, AniDB will also be updated

data.name: Tooltip_AniDBMyListState
data.value: The storage state files will be set to when added to your list

data.name: MSG_INFO_AddedQueueCmds
data.value: Command(s) have been added to queue

data.name: AniDBScheduleHTTP
data.value: Automatically Update Anime and Episode Information

data.name: Tooltip_AniDBScheduleHTTP
data.value: Update information about anime, and get new episode information. Only data which has changed since the last updated will be downloaded.

data.name: Tooltip_AniDBScheduleMyList
data.value: Sync information from AniDB according to the options specified in the MyList section.

data.name: DetailedInformationLink
data.value: Follow this link for an in depth explanation

data.name: Info_SettingsWebCache
data.value: The web cache is an online database created by the developers of Shoko and MyAnime. It's purpose is to fill in the gaps which other databases don't cater for, and also make the import process quicker by sharing information with other users of Shoko.

data.name: Tooltip_WebCache_Anonymous
data.value: By selecting this option your AniDB username will not be sent to the web cache. However this means you will not get the benefit of remembering your own personal selections.

data.name: Tooltip_WebCache_FileEpisodes
data.value: When files do not appear in AniDB, the web cache may have information about the episode relating to that file. This is especially useful when you manually link files and don't want to lose that information.

data.name: Tooltip_WebCache_FileHashes
data.value: Try getting the file hash from the web cache before hashing locally. This can save a lot of time when importing.

data.name: Tooltip_WebCache_TvDBAssociations
data.value: Use the web cache to look up links between AniDB and TvDB. If not selected you will need to manually search for all TvDB links.

data.name: Tooltip_TvDB_FanartAutoDownload
data.value: Automatically download new fanart whenever a import is performed.

data.name: Tooltip_TvDB_FanartCount
data.value: The maximum amount of fanart images to download

data.name: Tooltip_TvDB_PosterAutoDownload
data.value: Automatically download new posters whenever a import is performed.

data.name: Tooltip_TvDB_WideBannerAutoDownload
data.value: Automatically download new wide banners whenever a import is performed.

data.name: Tooltip_MovieDB_FanartAutoDownload
data.value: Automatically download new fanart whenever a import is performed.

data.name: Tooltip_MovieDB_FanartCount
data.value: The maximum amount of fanart images to download

data.name: Tooltip_MovieDB_PosterAutoDownload
data.value: Automatically download new posters whenever a import is performed.

data.name: Tooltip_LanguageUseSynonyms
data.value: Also use synonyms from selected preferred language for display of series and groups. English and Romaji synonyms will not be used

data.name: Info_SettingsLanguage
data.value: Set the language or languages used for naming when groups or series are added to your collection. These titles are pulled directly from AniDB so outside of English, Romaji or Kanji; not all groups or series will have additional titles available. To use synonyms listed on AniDB make sure to check “Also Use Synonyms” and to rename existing groups and series make sure to click “Rename All Groups/Series” once you’re done.

data.name: Tooltip_ImageSize_GroupList
data.value: The images shown in the main list when viewing the groups and series

data.name: Tooltip_ImageSize_SeriesPoster
data.value: The images shown in the right pane for all the series belonging to a group

data.name: Tooltip_ImageSize_SubGroupList
data.value: The images shown in the main list when viewing sub groups or series

data.name: Tooltip_Style_GroupList
data.value: The style of groups when displayed in the main list (also sub groups)

data.name: GroupFilter_ApplyToSeries
data.value: Apply filter at series level instead of group level

data.name: Tooltip_GroupFilter_BaseCondition
data.value: Include All so that all groups are included by default. Exclude All so that no groups are included, this is meant to be used when you want to manually specify groups on an indvidual basis.

data.name: GroupFilter_Category_Help
data.value: Double click on catgeories to add them to the selected list

data.name: MSG_ERR_RatingValue
data.value: Rating must be a value between 0 and 10. Decimal points are allowed.

data.name: MSG_ERR_DaysValue
data.value: Please enter the numbers of days as an integer (Minimum is 1)

data.name: EpisodeMarkAllWatchedPrevious
data.value: Mark All Previous Watched Including EP#

data.name: GroupFilter_VideoQuality_Help
data.value: Double click on the entries to add them to the list

data.value: Delete the database entry and the selected file on disk.

data.name: Tooltip_DeleteDuplicateFileEntry
data.value: Delete the database entry only. Files on disk will not be affected.

data.name: Tooltip_ReevaluateDuplicateFiles
data.value: Check all duplicate files entries to see whether the files still exist. If not delete the database entry

data.name: ImportSettings_UseEpisodeStatus
data.value: Set file as watched if episode is watched

data.name: Tooltip_TvDB_Schedule_Updates
data.value: Update series and episode information every 12 hours, and also download any new fanart, posters and wide banners

data.value: Search on the TvDB or enter TvDB Series ID

data.value: The images show in the episode detail

data.name: Info_SettingsUserAdmin
data.value: Users are stored in your database and can be accessed by any client that connects to your database. When adding a new user or updating an existing one, you must click the Save button otherwise your changes will not take effect. Shoko requires at least one user with administrator rights selected.

data.name: Tooltip_User_IsAniDB

data.name: Tooltip_RemoveMissingFiles
data.value: This will remove any video files entries from your database, where the file cannot be physically found. Make sure all your network shares are available or USB drives plugged before you run this.

data.name: Tooltip_UpdateMediaInfo
data.value: The Media Info is the information about your files such as bit rate, resolution codecs etc which is read and stored the first time you import a file

data.name: Tooltip_TraktAnimeOnly
data.value: Only show activity is related to anime (ie exclude other tv series)

data.value: Information is updated on server every 20 minutes

data.name: PromptRateSeries

data.name: Tooltip_MAL_UpdateFrequency
data.value: How often data is updated, and how often an automatic search is performed to look for anime in your collection which doesn't have a MAL link

data.name: Tooltip_UseFanartOnSeries
data.value: User Fanart instead of posters (where available) on Series Display

data.name: Tooltip_MAL_NeverDecrease
data.value: Make sure that watched counts are always kept. This requires downloading your full list each time you watch an episode, so may be time consuming

data.name: Tooltip_ReportLinkInfo

data.name: Tooltip_AutoLinkDisabledTvDB
data.value: Auto linking from this anime to a TvDB series is currently disabled

data.name: Tooltip_AutoLinkEnabledTvDB
data.value: Auto linking from this anime to a TvDB series is currently enabled. If Shoko Server finds a close match or community recommendation it will automatically create a link

data.name: Tooltip_AutoLinkEnabledTMDb
data.value: Auto linking from this anime to a MovieDB series is currently enabled. If Shoko Server finds a close match or community recommendation it will automatically create a link

data.name: Tooltip_CommunityAdminInfo
data.value: Go to the Community admin tab and edit the recommended links for this anime

data.name: UpdateAniDB_Info1
data.value: Data that's related to files in your collection is automatically downloaded and stored in your local database when Shoko first imports files. This process is only run once so if specific file data is missing on AniDB at the time of download, if will be missing in your database. Additionally, it's possible that future versions of Shoko might use additional file data that’s available but was not downloaded when Shoko initially imported your files. This utility will update and replace all stored file data with what's currently available on AniDB.

data.name: UpdateAniDB_Info2
data.value: Missing data usually relates to missing codec and resolution information. You may see Resolution: 0x0 next to these files

data.name: UpdateAniDB_Info3
data.value: Internal Version 2 added the following information - File version (v2, v3 etc), Is Censored, Is Deprecated

data.name: UpdateAniDB_Info4
data.value: Sending too many commands to AniDB, may cause a temporary ban. Use at your own risk

data.name: UpdateAniDB_HowManyQueued
data.value: How Many Commands Will Be Queued?

data.name: Anime_GotVids
data.value: Got vids for anime from service:

data.name: Tooltip_ClearImages
data.value: Clear all queued server image download commands

data.name: Downloads_BakaBTInfo
data.value: BakaBT is an anime torrent site which specializes in full series downloads, however it requires an account first

data.name: Downloads_AnimeBytesInfo
data.value: AnimeBytes is an anime torrent site which specializes in full series downloads, however it requires an account first

data.name: Tooltip_SyncMalDown
data.value: Download watched states from MAL, and update your local collection and AniDB.

data.name: Tooltip_SyncMalUp
data.value: Update MAL using the watched stats from your local collection

data.name: Tooltip_WebCache_AniDB_File
data.value: This is the data associated with each individual file. Recommended for large collections

data.name: AniDBScheduleMyListStats
data.value: Automatically Get MyList Stats From AniDB

data.name: BakaBTResetBody
data.value: Reset the cookie if you are not getting any results from BakaBT when you should be. This will force a login to BakaBT again.

data.name: BakaBTSeriesBody
data.value: When searching for a series, BakaBT (and AnimeBytes) will be the only torrent source used in the initial search

data.name: AnimeBytesResetBody
data.value: Reset the cookie if you are not getting any results from AnimeBytes when you should be. This will force a login to AnimeBytes again.

data.name: AnimeBytesSeriesBody
data.value: When searching for a series, AnimeBytes (and BakaBT) will be the only torrent source used in the initial search

data.name: Tooltip_IsVariation
data.value: Use this when you don't want a file to show up in the Multiple Files Control. This may be the case where you have multiple versions of an OP/ED for clean/no clean, director's cut and other types of variations

data.name: Tooltip_AniDBDownloadCharacters
data.value: These images are shown in MyAnime 3 and Anime Buddy

data.name: Tooltip_AniDBDownloadCreators
data.value: These images are shown in MyAnime 3 and Anime Buddy (Voice Actors)

data.name: Tooltip_AniDBMyListDeleteAction
data.value: What action to take for a file when you delete it from you local collection. Delete File (AniDB) - Removes file from your AniDB MyList. Delete File (Local DB) - Remove file from your local DB only. Mark Deleted - Leaves the file on your list, but changes the state to deleted. Mark External (CD/DVD) - Leaves the file on your list, but changes the state to external storage. Mark Unknown - Leaves the file on your list, but changes the state to unkown.

data.name: Tooltip_WebCache_UserInfo
data.value: Sends anonymous usage info to the web cache like Database Type, Windows version etc. See the help link for all the data that is sent

data.name: Tooltip_NewSeries_Search
data.value: Enter part of the name of the anime, or if you know the AniDB ID just enter that directly

data.name: Tooltip_SettingAlwaysAniDBPoster
data.value: This setting will over-ride any other Poster settings so that only the AniDB Poster is used. This is generally faster than using random posters

data.value: Click here for detailed explanation of options

data.name: VideoPlayer_AutoFileNote1

data.name: VideoPlayer_AutoFileNote2
data.value: Please note, if 'Release Group From Previously Played Episode' for 'Automatic File Selection - Subsequent Episodes In Series' is selected and you want to mark the file as watched instead of the episode. You'll need to uncheck 'Set File As Watched If Episode Is Watched" under Settings - Essental - Import Settings and then manually mark the file as watched, not episode as watched.

data.name: Language_RenameComplete
data.value: All groups and series have been successfully renamed!

data.name: RelationSettings_Info
data.value: If enabled, Shoko will group all related series in your collection based on the series relation graphs on AniDB. You can exclude certain types of relations by clicking the relation you don't want grouped.

data.name: Language_Info
data.value: Shoko Desktop needs to restart to change the language, click OK to auto restart or Cancel to manually restart.!

data.name: UpdateAniDB_QueueCount
data.value: {0} Files will be queued for processing

data.name: DefaultSeries_Info
data.value: If a default series is selected for a group, only that series images will be displayed instead of randomly selecting images from the different series within the group.

data.name: Tooltip_NameOverride
data.value: You can manually type the preferred name or use the green arrows to the right to select a name from AniDB

data.name: Tooltip_NameOverride2
data.value: Select a name from the list of available AniDB names

data.name: TvDB_DefaultLanguage
data.value: Select the language you'd like episode titles and descriptions to be downloaded in from The TvDB. Please note that if an episode title or description is not available in the language you've selected, the default English version will be downloaded.

data.name: Info_DuplicateFiles
data.value: This utility will show all instances where there are two or more files with the same hash. Shoko only allows you to have one file with the same hash in your collection.

data.name: Info_MultipleFiles
data.value: This utility will show all instances where you have multiple files for the same episode. You will be able to view each instance and decide which ones you'd like to keep.

data.name: IgnoredAnime_Note
data.value: This utility will show all anime series you have marked as ignored from the recommendations section. If you delete a series from this list, it's possible for it to show up in the recommendations section again.

data.name: MissingEpisodes_Note
data.value: This utility will show you a summary of all episodes you are missing from series in your collection. This utility runs in the background so you do not need to wait for the results. It may also take some time depending on how many missing episodes there are so please be patient.

data.name: MissingMyList_Note
data.value: This utility will compare your current collection with your AniDB MyList and display any file discrepancies between the two. You can review the results and have Shoko automatically remove all file discrepancies. Please note that Shoko will use your current collection as the base and remove all entries in your AniDB MyList that are not present in your current collection. This utility runs in the background so you do not need to wait for the results. It may also take some time depending on how many file discrepancies there are so please be patient.

data.name: SeriesWithoutFiles_Note
data.value: This utility will show all the series in your collection that do not have any files. Deleting the series from your collection will also delete the group if there are no other series in that group or if any additional series in that group do not have files.

data.name: Tooltip_WebCache_TraktAssociations
data.value: Use the web cache to look up links between AniDB and Trakt. If not selected you will need to manually search for all Trakt links.

data.name: TvDB_SearchInfo
data.value: The TvDB prohibits adult content, do not add adult related series to The TvDB or attempt to link it.

data.name: Tooltip_UpdateMovieDB
data.value: Download fresh data from The Movie DB and update the local database

data.name: LearnMore_VideoPlayer
data.value: Learn more about configuring a video player for use with Shoko

data.name: ShokoServer_ImportFoldersInfo
data.value: Fill out the form below to add an import folder. Input the folder's location, select the import type and then click Save to add the import folder.

data.name: Info_Downloads
data.value: Here you can configure your torrent program settings, what sites to use for searching and input your login information for supported sites.

data.name: LearnMore_WebCache
data.value: Learn more about the web cache

data.name: Info_SettingsDisplay
data.value: The display panel allows you to customize how series images and information is displayed.

data.name: LearnMore_Downloads
data.value: Learn more about using Shoko to download anime

data.name: ShokoServer_DDInfo
data.value: Please note, updating your drop destination will only affect new series being added. Series you've already imported will not be affected.

data.name: MovieDB_Info
data.value: While The Movie DB does index TV Series, Shoko only supports linking movies.

data.name: TvDB_ManualLink
data.value: If fixing an incorrect linking, please add it to the community links so other users can benefit from your correct link.

data.name: DeleteFile_Confirm
data.value: Select in which providers you want to Delete

data.name: Resume_Message
data.value: Do you want to resume the video at {0}?

data.name: Resume_Title
data.value: Do you want to resume the video?

data.name: TvDB_UpdateImages_Desc
data.value: This will update all local images from every source, excluding AniDB. Do not run this command if Server and Desktop are using the same folder as it will delete all your images.

data.name: Migration_AdminPass2
data.value: once this process is complete Shoko Desktop will close and no longer need Administrative Privileges to run.

data.name: Downloads_DisableRefresh
data.value: Only use when auto refresh is disabled

data.name: IgnoredAnime_DeleteMessage
data.value: Are you sure you want to delete this?

data.name: ImportFolder_Delete
data.value: Are you sure you want to delete the Import Folder: {0}? Any files in this folder will also be removed from the database.

data.name: VideoPlayer_PotPlayerNote
data.value: PotPlayer is capable of local files and streaming playback.

data.name: VideoPlayer_DefaultNote
data.value: Shoko Desktop is capable of using a variety of different video players for file playback. Listed below are supported video players and limited video players that are available for use with Shoko Desktop. You can change the video player Shoko Desktop uses by selecting one of the players from the list below. No configuration is required as Shoko Desktop pulls the video player's .exe file location from your registry.

data.name: VideoPlayer_MPVNote
data.value: If you decide to use your own version of MPV instead of the built-in version, make sure to associate playback with MPV. Otherwise Shoko Desktop will not be able to use it. External MPV also supports streaming playback and is the recommend Limited Video Player to use.

data.name: VideoPlayer_WindowsDefaultNote
data.value: If selected, will use the video player listed by Windows as the default player. Because of the wide range of players that can be used, only local playback of files is supported.

data.name: VideoPlayer_LimitedNote
data.value: The video players listed below are not fully supported and are included for legacy reasons. These video players only support the playback of files.

data.name: VideoPlayer_InternalMPVNote
data.value: Our built-in video player, MPV is a lightweight media player developed to run on a multitude of different operating systems removing bloat to provide a fast and powerful video player. No additional setup is required to use the built-in MPV player.

data.name: VideoPlayer_SupportedNote
data.value: The video players listed below are fully supported within Shoko Desktop, each video player is capable of resuming playback, updating watched states and Trakt scrobbling. Please read the information below the video players name for any additional setup required.

data.name: ImportSettings_AutoGroupSeriesUseScoreAlgorithm
data.value: Use Relation Weighting to Determine Main Series!

data.name: LocateSettingsFileQuestion
data.value: No previous configuration found, do you want to manually locate an existing configuration?

data.name: Migration_AdminFail
data.value: Shoko Desktop is unable to migrate your settings using the current user access. Run Shoko Desktop as an Administrator to start the migration.

data.name: Migration_AdminPass1
data.value: Shoko Desktop will now start migrating your settings from this location to

data.name: Migration_ProgramDataError
data.value: Error occurred during migration of programdata folder!

data.name: DuplicateInstallDetectedQuestion
data.value: You have both Shoko Desktop and JMM Desktop installed. Do you want to uninstall JMM Desktop?!

data.name: VideoPlayer_VLCInfo
data.value: In order to integrate VLC with Shoko Desktop, you must enable the Web UI via the following option in Tools > Preferences (select All radio-button) > Interface > Main interfaces > Web.

data.name: VideoPlayer_MPCInfo
data.value: In order to integrate MPC with Shoko Desktop, you must enable the Web UI via the following option in View > Options > Player > Web Interface > Listen On Port. The default listening port is 13579 which you can use, if you decide to change it make sure you change it in the box below.

data.name: VideoPlayer_ZoomPlayerInfo
data.value: No setup required, simply select Zoom Player as your Video Player.
